content.content: Dear Optimism Community, My name is Lukas and I’m a co-founder of CRNFT which is an "Upwork’’ for NFT and metaverse-related services. Here is the pitch deck We’ve been growing exponentially as more creators and partners come to our community. We are raising the 2M seed fund to scale and onboard 10 000 freelancers and their clients. On top of it, We really want to build this from scratch on the Optimism chain. Mission:  create a platform curated by its members. provide innovative solutions for brands entering the digital world build bridges between art, fashion, and architecture.  Happy to send over more information if this looks like something on your radar. My telegram is @nyclukas and I’m happy to answer all your questions.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is introducing CRNFT, a platform for NFT and metaverse-related services, and is seeking feedback and support for their 2M seed fund to scale and onboard 10,000 freelancers and their clients. The author also highlights the mission of the platform and invites interested parties to contact them for more information.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: crnft:  Upwor   Dear Lukas, Welcome to the Optimism Governance Forum. I find very interesting this kind of project where platforms are curated by its members. I very much hope see them working soon. As for project proposals, I suggest you check this:    Grant Proposal Template 🏛 Governance   Phase 1 Proposal Template v2 This is an update to the “How to Create a Proposal” post. Please reference the Gov Docs and operating manual for additional details on submitting proposals.   Key information about Governance Fund grants 5.4% of the total initial token supply (231,928,234 OP) will be distributed to Optimism projects and communities via the Governance Fund.  During Season 2, projects can continue to submit forum proposals to request any amount of OP tokens from the Governance Fund. A…       github.com   ethereum-optimism/OPerating-manual/blob/main/manual.md This document describes the current governance proposal process of the Optimism Collective. It will evolve, with the Collective, over time. The authoritative version is maintained [here](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/Operating-manual) on the Optimism Foundation Github.  ### **Operating Manual v0.2.1:  The Token House and OP Holders**  Governance in the Optimism Collective begins with the launch of the Token House and its members, the OP holders.  As Token House members, OP holders are responsible for submitting, deliberating, and voting on various types of Optimism Collective governance proposals.  In carrying out these functions, OP holders may either vote their OP directly (by delegating their OP voting power to their own address), or delegate their OP voting power to an eligible third party. Addresses with delegated OP voting power are called “delegates.” Delegates are expected to exercise their authority responsibly and in accordance with community standards.  The Token House is just the first part of the Optimism Collective [governance structure](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/). Launch of the Citizens’ House will soon follow and this Operating Manual will be updated accordingly.  ### **Governance Toolkit**  The primary tools for Optimism Collective governance are:  - [**Snapshot**](https://snapshot.org/#/opcollective.eth): Where all Token House governance proposals are submitted for vote. - [**The Optimism Forum**](http://gov.optimism.io): A platform for discussion and deliberation about governance proposals. - [**Discord**](https://discord-gateway.optimism.io/): For informal governance discussion and feedback.        This file has been truncated. show original      I look forward to hearing about your project soon. Best wishes
